courseDescription: This is an introductory course that emphasizes the concept of determining customer needs, wants, and desires and matching them to products and services for a long-term sales relationship.
This is an introductory course designed to teach the fundamental product and service promotion processes of planning and producing advertising and promotion campaigns.

courseTitle: Topics in STEM Education and Professional Studies
courseDescription: Topics of current interest in the area of STEM Education and Professional Studies.

This course is an analysis of dress in cultures around the world while developing an understanding of its relationship to human beings as biological, aesthetic, and social animals. Human beings dress their bodies to communicate identity and to receive personal satisfaction. Students will discover how global fashion, age, gender, ethnicity, and income influence the fashion industry and our lives.
Technical and Digital Skills: Research methodologies related to cultural studies
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication of personal identity through dress
Understanding and interpreting cultural differences in dress
Engaging with diverse perspectives on fashion and culture
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of fashion in relation to age, gender, ethnicity, and income
Analysis of the relationship between dress and identity
Understanding of the societal impact of fashion

courseDescription: This course intorduces students to the fundamentals of retail merchandising and explores retail buyers' skills and responsibilities including identifying customers and vendors, retail mathematics, buying plans, and merchandise control.
Technical and Digital Skills: Development and implementation of buying plans
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Identification and interaction with customers and vendors
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Customer and vendor identification and analysis

courseDescription: Course is designed for marketing education and fashion students.  It covers fashion as a force which alters patterns of change and growth in the fashion industry to include designers, manufacturers, buyers, retailers, and customers.  Students explore the latest trends in style and materials.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of various materials used in fashion
Understanding the role of designers, manufacturers, buyers, retailers, and customers in the fashion industry
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with different stakeholders in the fashion industry
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding of the factors that influence changes in the fashion industry
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Ability to manage and adapt to changes in the fashion industry

courseDescription: This course is designed to introduce students to the best practices and effective strategies in visual merchandising. It will provide the basic framework with which prospective merchandisers plan and construct visual displays that enhance the selling of merchandise and ideas.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration in visual merchandising strategy development
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating the effectiveness of visual displays
Enhancing merchandise sales through visual strategies

courseDescription: Whether high fashion or low, glitz or grunge, from revolutionary politics to the new machine age, war and depression to growth and prosperity, fashion dress and costume goes hand-in-hand with history.  This course examines the evolution of dress and costume and finds innovation at every turn.

courseTitle: Topics of current interest in the area of STEM Education and Professional Studies
courseDescription: Topics of current interest in the area of STEM Education and Professional Studies.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of current STEM software tools
Application of modern digital tools in STEM education

courseDescription: Students observe middle and/or high school classes for 30 clock hours.  Assist teachers and students in practical settings.  Relate principles and theories of education and specialty content to actual practice in the classrooms and schools.  Attend seminars related to contemporary school practices.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of educational theories and principles
Understanding of specialty content relevant to the observed classes
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with teachers and students
Observation and interpretation of classroom interactions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Application of educational theories to practical situations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Applying leadership skills in a classroom environment

courseDescription: Explores the skills and knowledge required of successful supervisors: leading, motivating, setting goals, delegating, budgeting, interviewing, negotiating, counseling, coaching, conducting meetings, and handling grievances.

This course is designed to enhance a student's understanding of what drives customers' wants and needs for fashion merchandise. Students examine the forces that affect consumer buying behavior and how they relate to the marketing of fashion.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Relating consumer behavior to marketing strategies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Predicting fashion trends based on consumer behavior
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Decision making based on consumer behavior analysis

courseDescription: Student participation for credit based on the academic relevance of the work experience, criteria, and evaluative procedures as formally determined by the department and the Cooperative Education program prior to the semester in which the work experience is to take place.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with department and the Cooperative Education program
Ability to present work experience in a relevant academic context
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to identify and evaluate academic relevance of work experience
Critical thinking to meet established criteria
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning work experience prior to the semester
Ability to adhere to formally determined procedures

courseDescription: An in-depth overview of education and training of adults.  Attention is given to adult learning theory and strategies for facilitating the learning process.  Aspects of the course will focus on helping students understand and visualize jobs and careers in adult education and training.
Technical and Digital Skills: Utilizing strategies for facilitating the learning process
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Visualizing jobs and careers in adult education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Application of adult learning theories in problem-solving
Analyzing various strategies for facilitating learning
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in adult education and training
Career planning and development in adult education

courseDescription: The department offers selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest.

Students learn how to design and develop classroom instructional materials including career and technical education and training curricula and programs for youths and adults.  Skills in this area include the selection and use of materials, including media and computers and evaluation of pupil performance.  Training specialist students learn to develop instructional materials using the instructional systems design process. Career and technical education students learn to plan instruction, to implement competency-based and standards-based education, and to modify and use the Virginia career and technical education curriculum guides.
Technical and Digital Skills: Design and development of classroom instructional materials
Use of media and computers for instruction
Development of instructional materials using the instructional systems design process
Implementation of competency-based and standards-based education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Modification of the Virginia career and technical education curriculum guides
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Implementation of career and technical education programs

courseTitle: Foundations of Career and Technical Education
courseDescription: This course is designed to teach career and technical education majors to plan, develop, and administer a comprehensive program of career and technical education for high school students and adults.  Students also develop an understanding of the historical and sociological foundations underlying the role, development and organization of public education in the United States.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of historical and sociological foundations of education
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Instructional planning for diverse student populations
Effective communication within an educational context
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizational understanding of public education in the United States

courseDescription: Designed to develop a student's ability to use basic instructional techniques and methods applicable to career and technical education, and adults in business, government, and industrial organizations.  It involves videotaped micro-teaching demonstrations and presentations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Utilization of video technology in teaching
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adaptation of teaching methods to various professional contexts
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in classroom or training settings

courseDescription: Student must be employed the summer prior to his/her senior year in an emphasis-related job approved by the instructor.  The student work is supervised by a job supervisor and the course instructor in a cooperative effort.  Must complete a job package that describes all aspects of the organization.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of organizational systems and processes
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating with job supervisor and course instructor

courseTitle: Advanced Classroom Issues and Practices in Career and Technical Education
courseDescription: An overview of classroom issues and practices for prospective career and technical teachers.  The course covers classroom management and safety, communication processes, reading in the content area and child abuse and neglect recognition and intervention.  Students learn the legal requirements and alternative teaching strategies for serving students with special needs.  Students visit schools for a 30-hour student observation.  PRAXIS II and VCLA are course completion requirements.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding and implementing legal requirements for special needs education
Child abuse and neglect recognition and intervention
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Alternative teaching strategies for students with special needs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing and adapting to student needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: PRAXIS II and VCLA preparation and completion

courseDescription: This is the study of planning and conducting a fashion buying trip to one of the major fashion markets in the United States like the Las Vegas Magic Trade Show.  The students envision themselves as buyers in action and learn how trend forecasting and creative presentations help market fashion products and services to trade customers and consumers.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and conducting a fashion buying trip

courseDescription: Students plan and conduct a fashion buying trip to a foreign market in Europe or Asia, and learn how to buy merchandise in the global marketplace.  The course requires students to go on the trip as well as attend the pre- and post-trip classes.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and conducting a fashion buying trip

courseDescription: This course is designed for marketing education and fashion students. It includes advanced merchandising math concepts used in the merchandising industry.  Topics include pricing and re-pricing merchandise, creating and analyzing six-month plans, maintaining inventory control, and solving problems that are typically experienced in the merchandising field.

This course is designed to apply diverse research methods to explore the complex dynamics in fashion. Utilizing an interdisciplinary approach, students will engage in diverse topics in fashion bridging the gap between theory and practice.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Bridging the gap between theory and practice
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of complex dynamics in fashion
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading fashion theory to practice transformations

courseDescription: Students work step-by-step through the preproduction processes of apparel product development:  planning, forecasting, fabricating, developing silhouettes and specifications, pricing, and sourcing.  The course demonstrates how these processes must be coordinated to get the right product to retail when consumers want it and at a price they are willing to pay.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving throughout the product development process

courseDescription: This course explores information related to new technological advances in the textile/apparel industry and determines consumer preferences and concepts of fashion product quality.  It includes the development of standards for judging qualities of merchandise.  Fabrics are examined to determine the value they provide to the apparel and accessories customer.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding consumer preferences in fashion and apparels
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of apparel and accessory quality
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Development of quality standards for merchandise
Understanding and applying new technologies in textile industry

courseDescription: This course explains key concepts of fashion marketing and illustrates how they are applied within the fashion industry. Using examples and case studies, students will examine how marketers develop and apply strategies that meet consumer needs for fashion products.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding consumer needs for fashion products
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within the fashion industry
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis and application of case studies
Evaluation and development of marketing strategies
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organization and execution of marketing strategies

courseDescription: This course provides the basic communications foundations needed to conceive, plan, develop, implement, and maintain a Web-based organization for fashion.  Upon completion, students will understand what is required to plan, launch and maintain a successful online venture, limited only by the willingness of the student to explore these technological advances.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication in planning and implementing web-based organization
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in maintaining a successful online venture

courseDescription: This course examines globalization and the development of an integrated global economy.  Primary emphasis is placed on the strategies for successful global business expansion for retailers in international markets.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving in context of international business

courseDescription: This course examines the role of global sourcing in the strategic positioning of retailers in the global economy.  Emphasis is placed on economic, political, logistical, and ethical factors affecting world trade and global sourcing decisions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Ability to evaluate economic factors affecting global sourcing
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Navigating political factors in global sourcing
Ethical decision making in global sourcing
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Strategic positioning in the global economy
Analysis and management of logistical factors

courseDescription: This course prepares training and educational professionals to plan for and conduct assessments to use in planning instructional programs, evaluate individual learning, monitor student progress, measure program effectiveness and efficiency, and evaluate the return on investments of training courses and programs.

courseTitle: E-Commerce and Social Media in Fashion
courseDescription: This course is designed to understand the expanding fields of e-commerce and social media. It will focus on examining features available in social media and the web/mobile technologies and their ability to improve fashion marketing strategies.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating effectiveness of digital marketing strategies

courseDescription: A senior capstone course in which fashion and business knowledge and skills are applied to plan and implement a merchandise retailing business.  Students must submit a professional quality written report and present results to a panel of consultants. Course to be taken final semester before graduation.

To provide the senior-level  student majoring in occupational and technical studies with the skills and techniques necessary to bridge the gap from college to career.  Focus is on the generation of a professional portfolio and experiential learning that will transfer into today's job market. This course should be taken in the final semester before graduation.

Classroom placement in school systems for students to apply content and methodologies.  The student is mentored by a school mentor and university faculty.  This course is for newly hired teachers on provisional contracts.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizational coordination with school and university mentors

courseDescription: Five days per week, full semester.  Available for pass/fail grading only.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching methods to individual student needs

courseTitle: Middle School Student Teaching for Technical Education
courseDescription: Classroom placement for student teaching in a middle school technology laboratory.  Students apply content and methodology under the supervision of a cooperating teacher and university faculty member. Available for pass/fail grading only.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Conveying technical concepts to a middle school audience
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adjusting teaching approaches based on student feedback
Problem-solving in a technology laboratory setting

courseDescription: The department offers selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work in subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.

courseTitle: Topics in Career and Technical Education
courseDescription: The department offers selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work in subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Technical and Digital Skills: Usage of digital tools for learning and research
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying relevant resources for specialized topics

courseDescription: Independent study.

Students learn how to design and develop classroom instructional materials including career and technical education and training curricula and programs for youths and adults.  Skills in this area include the selection and use of materials, including media and computers and evaluation of pupil performance.  Training specialist students learn to develop instructional materials using the instructional systems design process. Conveying the objectives and requirements of career and technical education programs
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Implementation of competency-based and standards-based education

Students also develop an understanding of the historical and sociological foundations underlying the role, development and organization of public education in the United States.

Designed to develop a student's ability to use basic instructional techniques and methods applicable to career and technical education, and adults in business, government, and industrial organizations.  It involves videotaped micro-teaching demonstrations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding career and technical education methods
Utilization of teaching methods applicable for business, government, and industrial organizations
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching methods to different occupational contexts
Evaluating the effectiveness of different instructional techniques

courseTitle: Methods in Career and Technical Education
courseDescription: A practical study and application of recommended methods of teaching career and technical education to high school students.  Video-taped micro-teaching demonstrations are included.  The course should be taken the semester prior to student teaching.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching methods to individual student needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and organization of teaching demonstrations

courseTitle: Advanced Classroom Issues and Practices in Career and Technical Education
courseDescription: An overview of classroom issues and practices for prospective career and technical teachers.  The course covers classroom management and safety, communication processes, reading in the content area and child abuse and neglect recognition and intervention.  Students learn the legal requirements and alternative teaching strategies for serving students with special needs.  Students visit schools for a 30-hour student observation.  PRAXIS II completion is a course requirement.
Technical and Digital Skills: Child abuse and neglect recognition and intervention

Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presentation of fashion products and services
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and conducting a fashion buying trip

courseDescription: Students plan and conduct a fashion buying trip to a foreign market in Europe or Asia, and learn how to buy merchandise in the global marketplace.  The course requires students to go on the trip as well as attend the pre- and post-trip classes.
Technical and Digital Skills: Effective use of digital travel tools

courseDescription: Students plan and produce a fashion show.  They examine each behind-the-scenes step from concept to execution as they organize and stage a show that is profitable, entertaining, and aesthetically pleasing.

This course is designed to introduce students to the best practices and effective strategies in visual merchandising.  It will provide the basic framework with which prospective merchandisers plan and construct visual displays that enhance the selling of merchandise and ideas.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with team for display construction

courseDescription: This course provides the basic communications foundations needed to conceive, plan, develop, implement, and maintain a Web-based organization for fashion.  Upon completion, students will understand what is required to plan, launch and maintain a successful online venture, limited only by the willingness of the student to explore these technological advances.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication for conception and planning of web-based organization

courseDescription: This course examines globalization and the development of an integrated global economy.  Primary emphasis is placed on the strategies for successful global business expansion for retailers in international markets.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of globalization and integrated global economy
Strategic planning for global business expansion
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Negotiation skills in an international context
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and overcoming barriers to global expansion

courseDescription: This course examines the role of global sourcing in the strategic positioning of retailers in the global economy.  Emphasis is placed on economic, political, logistical, and ethical factors affecting world trade and global sourcing decisions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of economic factors in global sourcing
Knowledge of political factors affecting world trade
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication in a global context
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Strategic decision making for global sourcing
Analytical skills for evaluating global markets
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizational skills for managing complex supply chains
Strategic planning for global market positioning

courseDescription: This course prepares training and educational professionals to plan for and conduct assessments to use in planning instructional programs, evaluate individual learning, monitor student progress, measure program effectiveness and efficiency, and evaluate the return on investments of training courses and programs.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating return on investment of training courses and programs

courseDescription: Classroom placement in school systems for students to apply content and methodologies.  The student is mentored by a school mentor and university faculty.  This course is for newly hired teachers on provisional contracts.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaboration with school staff and university faculty
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching strategies to individual student needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and organization of lesson plans

courseTitle: Middle School Student Teaching for Technical Education
courseDescription: Classroom placement for student teaching in a middle school technology laboratory.  Students apply content and methodology under the supervision of a cooperating teacher and university faculty member. Available for pass/fail grading only.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of middle school technology lab equipment
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting teaching methods to individual student needs
Identifying and solving technical issues in the lab

courseDescription: The department offers selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work in subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Solution development for complex, specialized issues
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Project organization within small group settings

courseTitle: Topics in Career and Technical Education
courseDescription: The department offers selected topics designed to permit small groups of qualified students to work in subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Independent study.

courseTitle: Problems in Occupational and Technical Studies
courseDescription: Taken the last semester of graduate work. Practice in the use of statistical and analytical techniques in solving problems in occupational and technical studies related to secondary, community college, and training environments.
The department offers selected topics designed to permit groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
The department offers selected topics designed to permit groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Individual study under the supervision of a graduate faculty member.
Research and writing of the master’s thesis and scheduled conferences with the candidate’s advisor.

courseTitle: Readings in Occupational and Technical Studies
courseDescription: A guided review of the literature to determine the history, development, and issues of occupational and technical education, including specialization in technology education, career and technical education specialties, and human resources training.

courseTitle: Trends and Issues in Training: Modeling and Simulation
courseDescription: This course is designed to explore the issues and trends in developing and implementing technology-based training with emphasis on modeling and simulation.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing trends and issues in technology-based training

courseTitle: Trends and Issues in Occupational Education
courseDescription: This course prepares training and educational professionals to plan for and conduct assessments to use in planning research findings and issues related to tech prep and other articulated programs being established in secondary schools, community colleges, and four-year institutions.
Technical and Digital Skills: Establishing articulated programs in various educational institutions
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborating with secondary schools, community colleges, and four-year institutions
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing issues related to tech prep and other articulated programs
Evaluating the effectiveness of training and educational programs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading educational program development and implementation

courseTitle: Foundations of Adult Education and Training
courseDescription: This course is a study of adult education and training in many settings including the community college, business, industry, labor, government, the military, and social service agencies of many types. An attempt will be made to assess the important trends or directions such activities are taking, including the needs of non-traditional learners and education and labor.
Technical and Digital Skills: Awareness of the intersection of education and labor
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to adapt communication to diverse learning environments
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Assessment of educational trends and directions
Identification of learning needs in different environments
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizational skills in diverse learning environments
Ability to navigate education and labor systems

courseTitle: Administration and Management of Education and Training Programs
courseDescription: This course deals with organizational policy, human and financial resources, facilities, and the planning process as applied to occupational education and adult training programs.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in education and training environments

courseTitle: Trends and Issues of Economic and Workforce Development
courseDescription: An analysis of economic trends and issues that lead to workforce development decisions. Focus is on planning for educational and training programs to meet workforce needs dictated by local and regional economic issues. This course is designed for community college and school system personnel.
Technical and Digital Skills: Planning for educational and training programs
Understanding local and regional economic issues
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Making informed decisions based on economic trends
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leadership in community college and school system environments

courseTitle: Curriculum Development in Occupational Education and Training
courseDescription: A course designed to prepare students to design and develop curriculum for occupational education and training courses and programs. Included is a focus on articulation between secondary and post-secondary curriculum.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of secondary and post-secondary education systems
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with various stakeholders in education
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Strategic planning and development of curriculums

courseDescription: Learn the various curriculum options taught in secondary schools under the auspices of career and technical education. Work from an administrative standpoint to learn the mission and goals of the various subject areas and plan to direct such efforts.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of diverse technical subject areas

courseTitle: Instructional Strategies for Innovation in Training and Occupational Education
courseDescription: Learning and teaching styles are considered as a basis for developing instructional strategies to maximize occupational and technical education at all levels, including secondary, the community college, and senior institutions. Relevant learning theories and knowledge of self, learner, and the environment are blended to enhance the participants' instructional strategies.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of different learning and teaching styles
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating complex concepts in an understandable manner
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Promoting innovation in the learning process

courseDescription: Individually prescribed instruction under the supervision of a graduate faculty member. Study intended to professionally fulfill development of graduate candidates.
The department offers selected topics designed to permit groups of qualified students to work on subjects of mutual interest which, due to their specialized nature, may not be offered regularly.
Individual study under the supervision of a graduate faculty member.

courseDescription: Analyses of current research and needs in occupational and technical studies.  Students analyze the literature and develop a research focus for future graduate studies.

courseDescription: Trends in philosophy, workforce needs, curriculum and teaching procedures in occupational and technical education. Familiarity with industry-specific tools and software

courseTitle: Instructional Technology in Education and Training
courseDescription: A course that provides insights about trends, issues, and the applications of instructional technologies as they may be applied to education and training environments. Topics include selected technical processes and electronic media to solve practical problems in educations and training.

Use of technology to solve practical problems in education and training
